subject: Economy
question_en: What is the role of RBI in regulating the money supply in the economy?
question_hi: RBI के लिए एक राज्य में नौकर का भाग क्या है?
A_hi: नौकरी का भाग मूल्यवर्धन का प्रभावों को उत्तराखंड को तिथियों के एनएमपी का विभिन्न
B_hi: नौकरी को उत्तराखंड के एनएमपी को अनुकुचरण
question_en: What is the primary role of the Reserve Bank of India in managing the country's monetary policy?

options.answer_en: Reserve Bank of India is the central bank of India and plays a crucial role in managing the country's monetary policy.
The primary role of the Reserve Bank of India is to regulate the money supply and maintain price stability in the economy.
The Reserve Bank of India determines interest rates and issues banknotes to control inflation and promote economic growth.
The Reserve Bank of India manages the liquidity of the financial system and regulates المصرفية institutions.
The Reserve Bank of India supervises and regulates the financial sector to promote financial stability.
The Reserve Bank of India conducts monetary transactions and provides banking services to the government and public sector banks.
The primary role of the Reserve Bank of India is to ensure price stability and maintain financial stability.
The Reserve Bank of India formulates monetary policy and issues banknotes.
The Reserve Bank of India is responsible for maintaining the stability of currency and banknotes.
The key function of the Reserve Bank of India is to regulate the banking system and control inflation.
